body.p:
Имеет ли суд свое течение и до чего уже дошол,— который наряжен в изследовании непослушания, индисциплины, и чрез то общее дело гибели в такой отважной битве, как была оборона самой, так-то сказать, столицы в 6 д. июля 1788 г. Ибо кто тут не делал свою должность и не боролся всеми силами, тот уже к чему может быть способен, и какую от него в каком деле ожидать можно ревность и усердие?
A.v. Khrapovitskii noted in his diary on July 11 1788 that Count Chernyshev showed him the letter from admiral Greig, in which he writes that not all of Russian ships participated in the battle and some of the captains did not execute the orders well, what was the reason for the ship "Vladislav" to get captured by Swedish navy. Greig accused captains of other ships: "Deris'" commanded by Savva Grigor'evich Kokovtsev, "Ioann Bogoslov" commanded by Stepan Aleksandrovich Val'ront, and "Pamiat' Evstafiia" commanded by Andrei Baranov. All three were dismissed and put on trial by Greig. Following the trial, A.V. Khrapovitskii remarked on July 18 1788 that the evidence of the guilt of three captains is growing stronger and that rear-admiral Martyn Petrovich von Dezin might get involved in this case, as he didn't signal to the ships to return back to the battle as they were leaving. On August 10 1788 in response to Catherine's request about the trial on three accused captains Khrapovitskii confirmed that it will soon be brought to a close. (
Dnevnik A.V. Khrapovitskago s 18 ianvaria 1782 po 17 sentiabria 1793 goda , pp. 61, 64, 73.
).
